{"step_by_step_thinking": "Inlay wax is a type of dental wax that is used in the creation of certain types of dental restorations. It is not used to temporarily cement inlays, that would be a temporary cement. It is also not used to invest inlay patterns or box models. The primary use of inlay wax in dentistry is to create patterns for inlays, which are then used to create the final restoration.", "answer_choice": "B"}
